node.title: Austria orders unvaccinated into lockdown amid COVID-19 surge
node.alt: People sit in a public garden
node.description: Millions of people not fully vaccinated against COVID-19 have been ordered into lockdown, as the European nation grapples with record infection levels and growing strain on intensive care units.
node.content:
["The Austrian government has ordered\u00a0millions of people not fully vaccinated against COVID-19 into lockdown, as the country grapples with a record surge of infections and growing pressure on hospitals.", "Europe has emerged as the epicentre\u00a0of the COVID-19 pandemic once again, prompting some governments to consider reimposing unpopular lockdowns.", "Austria has one of the continent's highest infection rates, with a seven-day average of 815 cases per 100,000 people.", "The country is the first European nation to reinstate severe restrictions used before\u00a0vaccines were rolled out, although this time they only affect a minority of the population.", "\"We are not taking this step lightly but it is necessary,\" Chancellor Alexander Schallenberg told a news conference.", "The move prohibits unvaccinated individuals older than 12 years from leaving their homes, except for essential activities, such as work, grocery shopping, exercise or getting vaccinated.", "", "
Many Austrians are sceptical about COVID-19 vaccines, a view encouraged by the country's far-right Freedom Party.(AP:\u00a0Lisa Leutner)
", "This\u00a0lockdown will affect\u00a0about two million people in the Alpine country of 8.9 million, news agency APA reported.", "Roughly 65 per cent\u00a0of Austria's population is fully vaccinated against COVID-19, one of the lowest rates in western Europe.", "Many Austrians are sceptical about vaccines, a view encouraged by the far-right Freedom Party, the third-biggest in parliament.", "The measures on Monday will extend those brought in a week ago, which banned the unvaccinated from public places, including restaurants, hotels, theatres and ski lifts.", "", "
Austrian Chancellor Alexander Schallenberg says police will be patrolling streets and checking vaccination status.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Lisa Leutner)
", "
Infection spike prompts hospital fears
", "In recent weeks, Austria has faced a worrying trend in infections.\u00a0", "The country reported a new daily record of 13,152 new cases on Saturday.\u00a0", "Authorities said they were concerned about rising deaths and the increasing pressure on hospital staff amid\u00a0the influx of COVID-19 patients.", "While the Netherlands is dealing with its surge in cases by imposing a partial lockdown that applies to all, Austria's conservative-led government wants to avoid imposing further restrictions on those who are fully vaccinated.", "\"That is a massive reduction in contacts between the vaccinated and the unvaccinated.\"", "", "
Authorities are concerned hospitals will be overwhelmed with a growing influx of COVID-19 patients.(Reuters:\u00a0Leonhard Foeger)
", "
Government flags police checks, stiff fines
", "The lockdown \u2014\u00a0which does not apply to the under-12s or to people who have recently recovered from COVID-19 \u2014\u00a0would initially last 10 days, Health Minister Wolfgang Mueckstein said.", "Interior Minister Karl Nehammer said there would be thorough police checks and fines of up to 1,450 euros ($2,265) for lockdown breaches, with police to patrol streets and check\u00a0people's vaccination status.", "Many officials, including within Mr Schallenberg's conservative party and the police, have expressed doubts the lockdown can be properly enforced as it applies to only part of the population.", "ABC/wires", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test.
"]
